channel.title: Stability Help [PI]
channel.description:
Hey, So I recently started my project but one thing I am stuck on is the stability.
In my other projects I didn't work on the stability but on this one I want to make it better as the engine load with only me online is 1.0%.
How do I got about to lower this and improve the stability as it is one of my goals which I really want to achieve.
What classes do I go about cleaning?
Thanks, RS PS
[IMG]http://i45.tinypic.com/30mags4.png[/img]

item.title: Stability Help [PI]
item.dc:creator: @RS_PS RS PS
item.description:
@RS_PS wrote:

Bump, Could anyone help me I can give you RSGP?

Read full topic

item.title: Stability Help [PI]
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

RiiPiiNFtW:

Clean it by removing all memory leaks, all unused methods, and turn if else statements into switch statements.

Unused methods will decrease performance. Switch statements are compiled into if else statements, so it’s the same thing just cleaner to some programmers eyes.

Do not try to remove the memory leaks, unless you absolutely know what you are doing; you do not want to remove something very important when thinking it might help. Update PI’s outdated networking, MINA, google it. Remove unused variables, remove unused player saving/loading tokens. Mess with the npc updating/overall system. Tweak combat a bunch. Limit the size of the buffer being sent each 600MS to an appropriate amount. Mess with the item handling system. Basically re-write everything ha.

Read full topic
